about.title: Get to Know me
description: Hello there, fellow visitor. Since you’ve made it this far, I should probably introduce myself. My name is Ricardo, I’m 26 years old, and I like to think of myself as a responsible, dedicated, and creative person — sometimes a bit too much. I studied Communication and Multimedia Design in Coimbra, where I quickly realized that what truly caught my interest was web development.

I started my journey in frontend because I genuinely enjoy solving problems. That feeling when something finally works exactly as it should? That’s what keeps me going. I enjoy both the visual and logical sides of development, but the truth is: I have the most fun turning ideas into functional logic.

I mainly work with React and its ecosystem, and I bring interfaces to life with GSAP whenever needed. My work philosophy is simple: everything goes smoother when there’s a clear vision of what’s expected — aligned communication prevents surprises, bugs, and premature grey hairs.

Day to day, I’m calm, curious, and a bit “optimization-obsessed” (even though I sometimes discover that there was an even better way to do something). Outside of coding, I enjoy sports — especially padel — playing online games with friends, streaming on Twitch, and watching good series and movies.
Fun fact: I used to compete in athletics and won national medals… so yes, I also know how to run after my goals.
